data.q: Which CSS property is required on a parent element to turn it into a flex container?
data.e: Setting `display: flex` (or `inline-flex`) initializes the flex formatting context for all direct children.

data.q: In Flexbox, which property is used to align items along the 'Main Axis'?
data.e: `justify-content` manages the distribution of space between and around content items along the main axis (usually horizontal).

data.q: How do you switch the 'Main Axis' from horizontal to vertical in a Flexbox container?
data.e: The `flex-direction` property defaults to `row`. Setting it to `column` makes the main axis vertical.

data.q: Which CSS Grid property is used to define the number and sizes of the columns in a layout?
data.e: `grid-template-columns` defines the line names and track sizing functions of the grid columns.

data.q: What does the `fr` unit represent in CSS Grid?
o: Fraction of the available space in the grid container
data.e: The `fr` unit allows you to create flexible grid tracks that grow and shrink to fill the remaining free space.

data.q: Which property allows a single flex item to grow and take up extra space if available?
data.e: `flex-grow` defines the ability for a flex item to grow if necessary, accepting a unitless value that serves as a proportion.

data.q: In CSS Grid, which shorthand property is used to define an item's position across multiple rows and columns?
data.e: `grid-area` can be used as a shorthand for `grid-row-start`, `grid-column-start`, `grid-row-end`, and `grid-column-end`.

data.q: What is the difference between `align-items` and `align-content` in Flexbox?
o: align-items works on a single line; align-content works on multi-line containers
align-items is for Grid; align-content is for Flex
align-items is for text; align-content is for blocks
data.e: `align-content` only has an effect when there is extra space in the cross-axis and the container has multiple lines (`flex-wrap: wrap`).

data.q: Which CSS Grid function is used to create a specified number of identical tracks efficiently?
data.e: The `repeat()` notation allows a large number of columns or rows that exhibit a recurring pattern to be written in a compact form.

data.q: How can you create a gap between rows and columns in both Flexbox and Grid using a single property?
data.e: The `gap` property (formerly `grid-gap`) is now supported in most modern browsers for both CSS Grid and Flexbox layouts.

data.q: What does `justify-self: center` do in a CSS Grid layout?
o: Centers the entire grid within its parent
Centers a specific grid item inside its allocated grid area along the inline axis
Centers all text within the grid
data.e: While `justify-items` is set on the container, `justify-self` allows an individual grid item to override that alignment.

data.q: In a Flexbox container, what is the default value of `align-items`?
data.e: By default, flex items `stretch` to fill the container's cross-axis height (or width, depending on direction).
